channel.title: [PHP]Change main page icon?
channel.description:
I am extremely new to PHP. I know how to do this in HTML, but obviously it wouldn't work. How do I change the icon that is on the left side of the address bar? (For moparisthebest.org it is the bulldozer, for google.com it's the google logo etc.) So is there a PHP equivalent for this?:
And would I put the icon in the same directory as index.php, or what? Thanks :D.

item.title: [PHP]Change main page icon?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

[quote=“D27L7T, post:5, topic:19080”]I would’ve just added a favicon.ico. :O[/quote]Favicon is only cross-browser compatible if it is in the root directory of the public html…besides, even when you do use favicon it is recommended that you use the link elements in the header to declare it for broswers that don’t call favicon by default.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP]Change main page icon?
item.dc:creator: @D27L7T D27L7T
item.description:
@D27L7T wrote:

I would’ve just added a favicon.ico.

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP]Change main page icon?
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

you shouldnt put everything in CAPS!
i prefer to do it this way though:
[php]echo “<link rel=“shortcut icon” href=”/pgIcon.ico">";[/php]

also you might wanna try putting a . (dot) in front of /pgIcon.ico

Read full topic

item.title: [PHP]Change main page icon?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Thanks for that, it’s working.

Edit: It worked for about 10 minutes and now it’s gone.
